Articles.Content:
I figured since I've been playing for three months now, I should probably join the forums, so here I am.

I found out about KSP when someone started discussing it on another forum I frequent, and since getting it, I've landed on Mun, Minmus and Gilly (and driven rovers on each of them), orbited Eve, Duna and Ike (also achieved low solar orbit), and done fly-bys of Moho and Dres (having been going too fast to slow down in time in both cases). Next I plan to fly out to actually get into orbit around those two, land on Ike, and go explore Jool and its moons.

Great achievements!

You don't really need to bring a lander for bodies like Ike,Gilly,bop or minmus,you can use EVA jetpack for that!

Good luck seeking for Eeloo landing!

Great achievements!

You don't really need to bring a lander for bodies like Ike,Gilly,bop or minmus,you can use EVA jetpack for that!

I know that - I once had a kerbal on EVA land on Gilly, plant a flag, and return to his ship, all while said ship was itself coming in to land.

Anyway, you do need a lander if you want to do science, which, since I stick to career mode, I do.

I've landed on Mun, Minmus and Gilly (and driven rovers on each of them), orbited Eve, Duna and Ike (also achieved low solar orbit), and done fly-bys of Moho and Dres (having been going too fast to slow down in time in both cases).

That's impressive for only three months of playing. Good luck on your next missions, and don't try to land on Jool!
